DOC.brief_summary: This study examine short term effect add manual therapy technique static stretch Dorsiflexion ( DF ) Range Motion ( ROM ) . The investigator study 2 form manual therapy , rear-foot thrust joint mobilization ( TJM ) , Instrument assist soft tissue mobilization ( IASTM ) . By compare 3 group : TJM+static stretch versus IASTM + static stretch versus static stretch alone investigator wish see short term benefit DF ROM add either intervention static stretching . The manual therapy treatment occur 2 session DF ROM measurement take 4 time 2 week period . The population investigator wish examine subject healthy foot ankle , limited DF ROM . The primary objective study see subject decrease dorsiflexion motion experience great increase dorsiflexion motion addition manual therapy static stretch alone . Our hypothesis subject receive manual therapy therapy static stretch experience significant increase DF ROM compare subject receive static stretch alone . More specifically subject treated IASTM experience great result subject treat rear-foot thrust mobilization .
DOC.brief_title: Does Addition Manual Therapy Techniques Increase Gastrocnemius/Soleus Length More Than Stretching Alone ?
DOC.criteria: healthy foot ankle must limit dorsiflexion ROM . Limited dorsiflexion judge patient < 12 degree DF PROM knee extend , < 50 degree weight bear DF ROM knee flexed . inability fully weight bear low extremity < 090 degree ROM knee inability follow direction presence Lower Extremity fracture pregnant nursing
